attributes.action: Create a department responsible for public sector IT projects.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With the well publicised failures of the CBA and more or less every EDS IT project. 

As IT becomes more and more important there needs to be a body to make best use of it.

It is time the government considered creating a department responsible for looking after government IT. 

It would typically be involved with 
Defining IT policy 
(Secure email, FTP etc...)

Creating the defining fixed specifications and implementing National scale IT projects.

The benefits to this approach are obvious.

Regain credibility.

You pay less as you are employing permanent staff (with comparable private sector packages)

Building a knowledge base inside government so as not to be ripped off when the grunt work is outsourced.

Projects become much predictable and feature creep can be better controlled.

Define a coherent national strategy, encompassing data security, reliability and accessibility so that information is useful to all, not just those using Microsoft. 

There are of course drawbacks, but these are outweighed by the benefits.
